Question_1.Context: The study focused on improving the selectivity of the methylation reaction to increase the radiochemical yield of [11C]7m6BP.
Question_1.Question: What solvent was found to improve the selectivity of the methylation reaction for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP?
Question_1.Source: The use of AcOEt improved the [11C]7m6BP/[11C]9m6BP selectivity in the methylation reaction.

Question_2.Context: The study aimed to investigate conditions for enhancing the selectivity of the methylation reaction for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP.
Question_2.Question: Which solvent showed a higher isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP in the automated synthesis?
Question_2.Source: The use of 2-MeTHF improved the isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP in the automated synthesis.

Question_3.Context: The study explored different solvents and temperatures to optimize the methylation reaction for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP.
Question_3.Question: At what temperature was the 11C-methylation reaction efficiently performed in 2-Methyltetrahydrofuran?

Question_4.Context: The study aimed to find conditions that would provide sufficient radioactivity of [11C]7m6BP for clinical use.
Question_4.Question: Which solvent showed a comparable isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP to THF in the automated synthesis?
Question_4.Source: The isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP in AcOEt was comparable to that in THF.

Question_5.Context: The study investigated the use of different solvents and methylating agents to enhance the selectivity of the methylation reaction.
Question_5.Question: Which solvent showed a low isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP in the automated synthesis?
Question_5.Source: When ACT was used as the solvent, the isolated RCYs of [11C]7m6BP were 6.6–11%.

Question_6.Context: The study aimed to optimize the conditions for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP to increase its radiochemical yield.
Question_6.Question: Which solvent showed a higher radiochemical purity of [11C]7m6BP at 60 minutes after synthesis?
Question_6.Source: The radiochemical purity of [11C]7m6BP in AcOEt was higher than 95% up to 60 min after being formulated.

Question_7.Context: The study focused on finding optimal conditions for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP to enhance its radiochemical yield.
Question_7.Question: Which solvent showed a low isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP in the automated synthesis?
Question_7.Source: When ACT was used as the solvent, the isolated RCYs of [11C]7m6BP were 6.6–11%.

Question_8.Context: The study aimed to investigate conditions for improving the selectivity of the methylation reaction for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP.
Question_8.Question: Which solvent showed a higher isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP in the automated synthesis?
Question_8.Source: The isolated RCY of [11C]7m6BP in THF was 24–28%.

Question_9.Context: The study focused on optimizing the conditions for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP to increase its radiochemical yield.
Question_9.Question: Which solvent showed a higher molar activity of [11C]7m6BP at the end of synthesis?
Question_9.Source: The molar activity of [11C]7m6BP in THF was 170 GBq/µmol at the end of synthesis.

Question_10.Context: The study aimed to optimize the conditions for the synthesis of [11C]7m6BP to increase its radiochemical yield.
Question_10.Question: Which solvent showed a higher ratio of the peak area for [11C]7m6BP to [11C]9m6BP in the HPLC chromatogram?
Question_10.Source: The ratio of the peak area for [11C]7m6BP to [11C]9m6BP in AcOEt was 1.2.
